com.cisco.mscviewer.model

Class MSCDataModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cisco.mscviewer.model.MSCDataModel

  • public final class MSCDataModel
extends java.lang.Object
    An MSCDataModel contains Entitys, Events and Interactions for a data model.

      Instantiate a data model

      • getInteractionsSurrounding

        public Interaction[] getInteractionsSurrounding(int modelIdx)
        returns an array of interactions whose source event has index <= modelIdx and sink event has index >= modelIdx. For interactions whose source/sink is null, this method assumes the interaction source/sink index has the same value as the corresponding sink/source. In other words, the interval of indices span by the Interaction is just one point.
        Parameters:
        modelIdx -
        Returns:

      • getInteractionsInInterval

        public java.util.ArrayList<Interaction> getInteractionsInInterval(int modelMinIdx,
                                                         int modelMaxIdx)
        returns an array of interactions whose source event has index <= modelMinIdx and sink event has index >= modelMaxIdx. For interactions whose source/sink is null, this method assumes the interaction source/sink index has the same value as the corresponding sink/source. In other words, the interval of indices span by the Interaction is just one point.
        Parameters:
        modelMinIdx -
        modelMaxIdx -
        Returns:

      • topoSort

        public void topoSort()
        Performs topological sorting of the model. Once an input file is loaded and the model created, due to skews in clocks of entities with non-synchronized clocks it is possible that an interaction may appear with the sink event preceding the source event. This is undesirable, as it can be confusing for the observer. This function performs a topological sorting of the graph represented by events and interaction to take care of this situation. Events may be "pushed up" or "pushed down" as long as this doesn't break any reasonable constraints.
        The topological sorting may fail if the model has unexpected loops (for example events e1, e2, belonging to entity E1, e3, e4 to entity E2, and interactions e1->e4, e4->e2, e2->e3, e3->e1 (which would imply e1 happened before itself).
        Parameters:
        obs -

      • getEventByLineIndex
